projects.title: Procedural Animation in Unreal Engine
projects.description: The project showcases a procedural animation system developed in Unreal Engine, utilizing the Control Rig system and Full Body IK node. The control rig was created with bone controllers for manipulating the gecko's feet based on external data. Feet position was calculated using line traces, allowing the gecko to step in an arc onto new positions. The Full Body IK node calculated bone positions using inverse kinematics algorithms, resulting in realistic character animations. A post-process animation blueprint enhanced believability by layering multiple animations, incorporating physical simulations, and adjusting body parts. This blueprint seamlessly blended animations to create lifelike gecko behavior. The project leverages Unreal Engine's powerful animation tools to achieve dynamic and immersive character movements

projects.title: Unreal AR Pong Game
projects.description: BeerPog Champ is an AR-based game inspired by Beer-Pong. Using motion sensor data, players throw virtual ping-pong balls into cups on a virtual table. The game features a simple menu system and aims to provide fun gameplay.

projects.title: Gek-Go
projects.description: A DES310 group project, mentored by Rockstar. I worked as the engine and tools programmer for this project, developing the initial traversal mechanic for the beta build. After that I went on to work on the water shader, skybox, butterfly particle effects, animations in unreal engine, and inverse kinematics.

projects.title: AI Handwritten Digit-Recognition
projects.description: Handwritten digit recognition using the MNIST dataset is based ona feed forward neural network architecture and uses a softmax actiavtion function, It is a shallow neural network with no hidden layers. SFML library is used for GUI. The number 6 and 9 do not get recogenised properly in this version, maybe due to the limited training data provided and lack of hidden layers

projects.title: AI Image-Classifier
projects.description: The project is an image classifier developed using Jupyter Notebook and Python. It utilizes a convolutional neural network trained on the CIFAR-10 dataset. Google Colab is used for dataset loading and model training, while the Keras API enables quick definition of deep learning models. Tkinter graphics library provides a graphical user interface for custom image inputs.

projects.title: AI Patrol Mechanic Unreal Engine
projects.description: Patrol Mechanic is an Unreal Engine project showcasing AI patrol guards. Utilizing behavior trees and task nodes, the guards are programmed to protect predefined paths. They employ sight and hearing senses to detect and respond to the player's presence, initiating a chase if spotted. The project highlights the implementation of multiple AI guards to enhance security and create engaging gameplay scenarios.

projects.title: DirectX Shaders
projects.description: A CMP301 project, uses D3D11 Shaders to render a scene from the cult anime Neon-Genesis Evangelion. Gerstner Wave Equation is used for water simulations. Bloom is applied to both the light sources in the scene including the water.

projects.title: OpenGL Graveyard Scene
projects.description: Graveyard Scene is an OpenGL project that immerses you in a hauntingly beautiful graveyard setting. It features a spooky tree, eerie tombstones, and a captivating cottage at the scene's center. The project demonstrates various techniques such as reflection, lighting, and procedural cylinder generation for a well. Additionally, it incorporates object loading and showcases a dynamic day and night cycle, adding depth and realism to the atmospheric experience.

projects.title: Carbon Rapture
projects.description: Carbon Rapture is a game jam entry for the ASGJam focused on carbon capture for climate action. It offers an engaging and educational experience, teaching players about the process of carbon capturing through  interactive gameplay and intuitive mechanics, , promoting awareness and knowledge about this important environmental process.

projects.title: Loopy Trajectory
projects.description: Loopy Trajectory is a thrilling game jam creation, with the theme of revolution in mind, it is reminiscent of the sensation 'Getting Over It.' Developed in Unity, the game follows the captivating story of Bob, a stranded spaceship pilot trapped in interstellar space. Players embark on an epic journey, maneuvering through challenging levels by utilizing wormholes to reach home. With an engaging storyline and narrative crafted by me, the game immerses players in Bob's extraordinary quest. The evocative audio design, featuring a narrator delivering memorable quotes like 'Don't hate the player, hate the game,' adds an extra layer of depth to this gripping experience.
